manify.predictors.midpoint

Compute the angular midpoints between two angular coordinates in different geometric spaces

Functions

euclidean_midpoint(u, v)

Compute the euclidean midpoint between two angular coordinates u and v.

hyperbolic_midpoint(u, v[, assert_hyperbolic])

Compute the hyperbolic midpoint between two angular coordinates u and v.

is_hyperbolic_midpoint(u, v, m)

Verifies if m is the true hyperbolic midpoint between u and v.

midpoint(u, v, manifold[, special_first])

Driver code to compute the midpoint between two angular coordinates give the manifold type.

spherical_midpoint(u, v)

Compute the spherical midpoint between two angular coordinates u and v.
manify.predictors.midpoint.euclidean_midpoint(u, v)

Compute the euclidean midpoint between two angular coordinates u and v.

Parameters:

  • u (torch.Tensor) – The first angular coordinate.

  • v (torch.Tensor) – The second angular coordinate.

Returns:

The computed spherical midpoint between u and v.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

manify.predictors.midpoint.hyperbolic_midpoint(u, v, assert_hyperbolic=False)

Compute the hyperbolic midpoint between two angular coordinates u and v.

Parameters:

  • u (float) – The first angular coordinate.

  • v (float) – The second angular coordinate.

  • assert_hyperbolic (bool) – A boolean value. If True, verifies that the midpoint satisfies the hyperbolic

  • False. (distance property. Defaults to)

Returns:

The computed hyperbolic midpoint between u and v.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

manify.predictors.midpoint.is_hyperbolic_midpoint(u, v, m)

Verifies if m is the true hyperbolic midpoint between u and v.

Parameters:

  • u (torch.Tensor) – The first angular coordinate.

  • v (torch.Tensor) – The second angular coordinate.

  • m (torch.Tensor) – The candidate midpoint to verify.

Returns:

True if m is the true hyperbolic midpoint between u and v, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

manify.predictors.midpoint.midpoint(u, v, manifold, special_first=False)

Driver code to compute the midpoint between two angular coordinates give the manifold type.

This function automatically selects the appropriate midpoint calculation depending on the manifold type. It supports hyperbolic, Euclidean, and spherical geometries.

Parameters:

  • u (Float[Tensor, '']) – The first angular coordinate.

  • v (Float[Tensor, '']) – The second angular coordinate.

  • manifold (Manifold) – An object representing the manifold type.

  • special_first (bool, optional) – If True, uses the manifold-specific midpoint

  • False. (calculations given the manifold type of hyperbolic or euclidean. Defaults to)

Returns:

The computed midpoint between u and v, based on the selected geometry.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

manify.predictors.midpoint.spherical_midpoint(u, v)

Compute the spherical midpoint between two angular coordinates u and v.

Parameters:

  • u (torch.Tensor) – The first angular coordinate.

  • v (torch.Tensor) – The second angular coordinate.

Returns:

The computed spherical midpoint between u and v.

Return type:

torch.Tensor
